subsections.title: ARQ Systems
subsections.label: subsec:arq-systems

questions.question: What is an ARQ transmission system?

choices.A: A special transmission format limited to video signals
choices.B: A system used to encrypt command signals to an amateur radio satellite
choices.C: An error correction method in which the receiving station detects errors and sends a request for retransmission
choices.D: A method of compressing data using autonomous reiterative Q codes prior to final encoding

prompts: Explain the concept of Automatic Repeat Request (ARQ) and its role in error correction during data transmission.
Describe the process by which ARQ systems detect errors and request retransmission.
Discuss the advantages and limitations of ARQ systems in radio communication.
Provide examples of real-world applications where ARQ systems are used.
